class.name: Phaser.FrameData
class.help: FrameData is a container for Frame objects, which are the internal representation of animation data in Phaser.

public.name: addFrame

returns.help: The frame that was just added.

public.help: Adds a new Frame to this FrameData collection. Typically called by the Animation.Parser and not directly.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: The frame to add to this FrameData set.

public.name: checkFrameName

returns.help: True if the frame is found, otherwise false.

public.help: Check if there is a Frame with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of the frame you want to check.

public.name: clone

returns.help: A clone of this object, including clones of the Frame objects it contains.

public.help: Makes a copy of this FrameData including copies (not references) to all of the Frames it contains.

public.name: getFrame
public.help: Get a Frame by its numerical index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index of the frame you want to get.

public.name: getFrameByName
public.help: Get a Frame by its frame name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of the frame you want to get.

public.name: getFrameIndexes

returns.help: An array of all Frame indexes matching the given names or IDs.

public.help: Returns all of the Frame indexes in this FrameData set.\nThe frames indexes are returned in the output array, or if none is provided in a new Array object.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.help: An Array containing the indexes of the frames to retrieve. If the array is empty then all frames in the FrameData are returned.

parameters.name: useNumericIndex
parameters.help: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings? (false)

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.

public.name: getFrameRange

returns.help: An array of Frames between the start and end index values, or an empty array if none were found.

public.help: Returns a range of frames based on the given start and end frame indexes and returns them in an Array.

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.

public.name: getFrames

returns.help: An array of all Frames in this FrameData set matching the given names or IDs.

public.help: Returns all of the Frames in this FrameData set where the frame index is found in the input array.\nThe frames are returned in the output array, or if none is provided in a new Array object.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.help: An Array containing the indexes of the frames to retrieve. If the array is empty then all frames in the FrameData are returned.

parameters.name: useNumericIndex
parameters.help: Are the given frames using numeric indexes (default) or strings? (false)

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: If given the results will be appended to the end of this array otherwise a new array will be created.

public.name: total
public.inlineHelp: The total number of frames in this FrameData set.

private.name: _frameNames
private.inlineHelp: Local array of frame names for name to index conversions.
